text: "We had 200 developers on a mainframe.  The first workstation [as opposed to PC] I had was faster than the mainframe," says my dad.  He goes on, but the short is that there was no regression until, "In some ways, my development environment is no more performant now.  We're using the same tools I was using in 1979.  There are newer versions, but they're bigger and slower... It takes me almost as long to compile now as it did then.  At times I want to kick and scream and kick over the apple cart."
